title: Cirrus Logic stock surges after revenue tops Wall Street expectations
text: Cirrus Logic Inc. CRUS, +0.79% shares surged roughly 4% Wednesday in the after-hours session after the copmany topped consensus revenue estimates. The company reported fiscal second-quarter net income of $76.2 million, or $1.27 a share, compared with $58.1 million, or 93 cents a share, in the year-ago period. Adjusted for items such as stock-based compensation, earnings were $1.55 a share. Revenue rose to $388.9 million from $366.3 million in the year-ago period. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had estimated adjusted earnings of 94 cents a share on revenue of $322 million. For the third quarter, analysts model adjusted earnings of $1.05 a share on sales of $339 million. Cirrus Logic said it expected third quarter revenue from $325 million to $365 million. Cirrus Logic stock has gained 76% this year, as the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.33% rose 21%.
